abstract: Originally scheduled for release about three weeks before next year's election -- potentially helping President Obama -- the film is now said to be scheduled to appear after the election.
snippet: Originally scheduled for release about three weeks before next year's election -- potentially helping President Obama -- the film is now said to be scheduled to appear after the election.
lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES - The fuss over whether Sony Pictures and the filmmakers Mark Boal and Kathryn Bigelow were playing politics when they scheduled their hunt-for-Bin Laden film for release on Oct. 12, shortly before next year's presidential election, may soon be irrelevant. Sony is planning to move the as-yet untitled film until after the election, according to two people who were briefed on the studio's plans. Both said the picture is now virtually certain to appear after the election, and might not be released until early in 2013.

headline.main: Release Date of Bin Laden Film May Change
